SENT.plain: Burkitt lymphoma (BL), an aggressive non-Hodgkin lymphoma, usually presents with large extranodal masses involving jaw bones, intestines and central nervous system
There are 3 main types of BL: endemic, sporadic, and immunodeficiency variant
Although each variant frequently involves extranodal site, cutaneous involvement is distinctly rare
Most of the previously reported cases with cutaneous involvement occurred at relapse, or in an immunocompromised host
The mode of spread may be direct extension or hematogenous spread
We report a 17-year-old boy who presented with multiple large subcutaneous nodules as initial manifestation of BL that may have been due to hematogenous spread
